Farmakin 'yan ta'adda kan sojoji ya tsananta a yankin Sahel
05 Nov 2019, 13:18 by Abdurrahman Gambo Ahmad

'Yan ta'adda sun sake kaddamar da wani sabon farmaki a Burkina Faso,inda suka kashe jami'an tsaro biyar,  harin da ke zuwa a daidai lokacin da ake zaman makoki a Mali biyo bayan kisan da 'yan ta'ddan suka yi wa sojojin kasar kimanin 50. 

Kazakila mayakan masu ikirarin jihadi sun kai makamancin wannan harin Jancinsa a jamhuriyar Nijar, inda suka hallaka sojojin kasar 12, lamarin da ya sa ake diga ayar tambaya dangane da amfani ko rashin amfanin dubban dakarun kasashen Yammacin Duniya da ke jibge a cikin wadannan kasashe na yankin Sahel.
Ko a Najeriya, mayakan sun sha kaddamar da irin wannan farmakin kan jami'an tsaro musamman a yankin arewa maso gabashin kasar mai fama da rikicin Boko Haram.
A yayin zantawa da sashen hausa na RFI, Alkassoum Abdourahman mai sharhi kan lamurran yau da kullum a Jamhuriyar Nijar, ya ce, muddin ba a dauki mataki cikin gaggawa ba, wasu yankuna za su bukaci ballewa daga wadannan kasashe domin cin gashin kansu.
Kuna iya latsa alamar sautin da ke kasa domin sauraren cikakkiyar hirar da Abdoulkarim Ibrahim Shikal ya yi da Alkassoum Abdourrahman.
Alkassoum Abdourahman mai sharhi kan al'amuran yau da kullum, kan yawaitan hare-hare a yankin Sahel 05/11/2019 - Daga Ahmed Abba



Masharhancin ya ce, 'yan ta'addan na samun karin goyon baya daga kungiyoyin'yan ta'adda na wasu kasashen duniya kamar Syria wadda ta kasance cibiyar mayakan IS.

Attacks on terrorists have intensified in the Sahel region
05 Nov 2019, 13:18 by Abdurrahman Gambo Ahmad

Terrorists launch new attack in Burkina Faso, killing five security forces about 50 soldiers.

It is likely that jihadist militants have carried out a similar attack in January in Niger, killing 12 soldiers, raising the question of whether or not to use the thousands of Western troops deployed in these regional countries. Sahel.
Even in Nigeria, insurgents have launched similar attacks against security forces, especially in the northeastern part of the Boko Haram crisis.
In an interview with the RFI's Hausa section, Alkassoum Abdourahman, a daily affairs analyst in Niger, said that unless urgent action is taken, some regions will need to secede from these countries for independence.
You can click on the audio link below to listen to the full interview of Abdoulkarim Ibrahim Shikal and Alkassoum Abdourrahman.
Alkassoum Abdourahman is a daily commentator on the numerous attacks on the Sahel region 05/11/2019 - By Ahmed Abba



The source said the terrorists are getting more support from international terrorist groups such as Syria, which has been the center of IS militants.
